alert.note: Alert for Cooke; Montague (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued August 21 at 1:49PM CDT until August 21 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR LOW HUMIDITY, MODERATE WINDS, AND DROUGHT STRESSED VEGETATION FOR ALL BUT NORTHEAST TEXAS... * AFFECTED AREA...All areas along and west of the I-35 corridor or along and south of I-20. * TIMING...Through 9 pm today. * WINDS...East 10 to 15 mph with gusts up to 25 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...20 to 29 percent. * TEMPERATURES...Around 105 degrees * IMPACTS...Rapid ignition and spread of wildfires is possible due to persistent hot and dry conditions.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that extreme fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and dry vegetation can contribute to extreme fire behavior. Avoid all outside burning and welding today. Do not toss lit cigarette butts outside. Report wild fires to the nearest fire department or law enforcement office.
